page.title: 14HILLFIELD FARM, TOOT BALDON
page.content: Ronald and Dorothy Brook rent 66 acres from Oxfordshire County Council. It is a dairy farm with 60 milk cows,1 bull and some heifers. His day starts at 6 a.m. Milking takes 1.5 hours, in a 6 bay parlour. He breakfasts after seeing to the calves, his horse and pony. Office work is done on rainy days. Four sons help at busy times; 3 are in farming and 1 in a factory. Silage is made, straw collected from other farms. Hay from Nuneham Arboretum is saved for the calves winter feed. Milk is collected every morning by tanker and taken to Ruislip,Middx. The house was built in 1938; Mr. Brook moved there 10 years ago. He comes from Lancashire, having trained at Agricultural College after National Service. Previously they had a small market garden in Hampshire.
